abstract_summ: In this study, a risk model was developed for predicting rehabilitation duration of the mild-moderate COVID-19 cases, thereby conducting refined risk management for different risk population.OBJECTIVE This article estimates the incidence and fatality of COVID-19 and identify potential risk factors to fatality in patients with active epilepsy.CONCLUSIONS The proposed model is a useful tool for the individualized risk management of mild-moderate COVID-19 cases for the first time, and it may readily facilitate dynamic clinical decision-making for different risk populations.Abstract While elderly patients are at high risk of fatality, research concerning COVID-19 has largely been done on clarifying the clinical features.According to the local epidemic situation, risk management was conducted by weighing the risk assessment for different risk populations.
title_summ: Prediction of the rehabilitation duration and risk management for mild-moderate COVID-19.Risk Factors Prediction, Clinical Outcomes, and Mortality of COVID-19 PatientsRisk assessment and prediction of severe or critical illness of COVID-19 in the elderlyRisk factors for predicting mortality in elderly patients with COVID-19: a review of clinical data in ChinaIncidence and case fatality rate of COVID-19 in patients with active epilepsy.
title_abstract_phrases: CONCLUSIONS The proposed model is a useful tool for the individualized risk management of mild-moderate COVID-19 cases for the first time, and it may readily facilitate dynamic clinical decision-making for different risk populations.In this study, a risk model was developed for predicting rehabilitation duration of the mild-moderate COVID-19 cases, thereby conducting refined risk management for different risk population.Risk factors for predicting mortality in elderly patients with COVID-19: a review of clinical data in ChinaAbstract While elderly patients are at high risk of fatality, research concerning COVID-19 has largely been done on clarifying the clinical features.According to the local epidemic situation, risk management was conducted by weighing the risk assessment for different risk populations.OBJECTIVE This article estimates the incidence and fatality of COVID-19 and identify potential risk factors to fatality in patients with active epilepsy.
